member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2
member.summary: A collection is a multiset of records that varies according to a logical timestamp.
member.typeparam: The type of records in the collection.
The type of timestamp on each record.
member.remarks: The type parameter is used to ensure that collections are combined in compatible ways, and need not be manipulated directly by the programmer. Initially, collections have an integer-valued timestamp, which indicates that they vary according to a stream of input epochs. The method is used to refer to a collection within a loop, by augmenting its timestamp to have an value with an additional loop counter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.PartitionBy``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})
member.summary: Partitions a collection by the given key selector.
member.param: Function that extracts a key from each record.
member.returns: A collection with the same elements, but in which all records with the same key will be processed by the same worker.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.Consolidate
member.summary: Consolidates a collection so that each record occurs with at most one weight.
member.returns: A collection with the same elements, but in which all identical records are stored once with a canonical weight.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.Consolidate``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})
member.summary: Consolidates representation so that each record occurs with at most one weight.
member.param: Function that extracts a key from each record.
member.returns: A collection with the same elements, but in which all identical records are stored once with a canonical weight, and all records with the same key will be processed by the same worker.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.GroupBy``3(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``1}},System.Func{``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``2}})
member.summary: Groups records using the supplied key selector, and applies the given reduction function.
member.param: Function that extracts a key from each record.
Function that transforms a record to the intermediate value that is stored for each record.
Function that transforms a sequence of intermediate values to a sequence of output records.
member.returns: The collection of output records for each group in the input collection.
member.remarks:
This overload can reduce the amount of storage required compared to in cases where the intermediate value is small relative to each original record.
If the reducer is a commutative and associative aggregation function, consider using the (or a related aggregation) operator, which stores a single value for each key, rather than a sequence of values.

member.remarks:
The overload can reduce the amount of storage required compared to this overload in cases where the intermediate value is small relative to each original record.
If the is a commutative and associative aggregation function, consider using the (or a related aggregation) operator, which stores a single value for each key, rather than a sequence of values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.Union(Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection{`0,`1})
member.summary: Computes the multiset union of this collection and the collection.
member.param: The other collection.
member.returns: The collection containing the multiset union of the two input collections.
member.remarks:
The multiset union contains each record in either this collection or the collection. For each record in either collection, the multiplicity of that record in the multiset union will be the greater of its multiplicities in either collection.
The union operator is stateful. If precise multiplicities are not important (e.g. because the output feeds into a , , or similarly idempotent operator), the operator is a more efficient substitute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.Intersect(Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection{`0,`1})
member.summary: Computes the multiset intersection of this collection and the collection.
member.param: The other collection.
member.returns: The collection containing the multiset intersection of the two input collections.
member.remarks: The multiset union contains each record in both this collection and the collection. For each record in both collections, the multiplicity of that record in the multiset intersection will be the lesser of its multiplicities in either collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.SymmetricDifference(Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection{`0,`1})
member.summary: Computes the multiset symmetric difference of this collection and the collection.
member.param: The other collection.
member.returns: The collection containing the multiset symmetric difference of the two input collections.
member.remarks: The multiset symmetric difference contains each record that is in the , but not in the of this collection and the collection. For each record in either collection, the multiplicity of that record in the multiset symmetric difference is the absolute value of the difference between its multiplicities in either collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.Concat(Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection{`0,`1})
member.summary: Computes the concatenation of this collection and the collection.
member.param: The other collection.
member.returns: The collection containing all records in the two input collections.
member.remarks: This operator is stateless. As such, it can be a more efficient alternative to the operator, when precise multiplicities are not important (e.g. because the output feeds into a , , or similarly idempotent operator).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection`2.Except(Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection{`0,`1})
member.summary: Computes the multiset difference of this collection minus the collection.
member.param: The other collection.
member.returns: The collection containing all records in this collection that are not in the collection.
member.remarks: The behavior of this operator is undefined when the collection contains records that are not in this collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Differential Dataflow framework contains extension methods that support LINQ-style incremental and iterative operators.
member.remarks:
The Differential Dataflow operators are defined in terms of objects, each of which wraps a Naiad stream and allows it to be interpreted with multiset semantics.
The class is the Differential Dataflowspecific wrapper for the Naiad class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.InputCollection`1
member.summary: A that can be modified by adding or removing records.
member.typeparam: The type of records in this collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.InputCollection`1.OnCompleted(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Weighted{`0}})
member.summary: Introduces a batch of to this collection in a new , and signals that no more records will be added to or removed from this collection.
member.param: The records to be added or removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.InputCollection`1.OnNext(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Weighted{`0}})
member.summary: Introduces a batch of to this collection in a new .
member.param: The records to be added or removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.InputCollection`1.OnCompleted
member.summary: Signals that no more records will be added to or removed from this collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.CollectionTrace.CollectionTrace`1
member.summary:
Interface for a collection trace, which is a mapping from key indices (of type int) to times (interned, of type int) to records (of time R), to weights (of type int).
Typically the key indices are obtained from a Operator.KeyIndices structure, which indicates which offsets in some internal data structure are used for the unprocessed, processed, etc. regions of the collection trace.
Typically the time indices are obtained from a LatticeInternTable object associated with the enclosing operator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.CollectionTrace.CollectionTrace`1.Introduce(System.Int32@,`0,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Introduces the given record with the given weight at a particular (key, time).
After executing this method, the keyIndex may have changed.
member.param: The index for the key to update.
The record to introduce.
The weight of the record to introduce.
The index for the time to update.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.CollectionTrace.CollectionTrace`1.IntroduceFrom(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Introduces a batch of records from a source region in this collection trace (typically corresponding to an unprocessed trace or a workspace) to a destination region.
After executing this method, the destKeyIndex and sourceKeyIndex may have changed.
member.param: The index for the destination, which will be updated.
The index for the source for the the update.
If true, this will free the storage associated with the sourceKeyIndex.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.CollectionTrace.CollectionTrace`1.SubtractStrictlyPriorDifferences(System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Updates dA[t] to be the negation of all strictly prior differences, where A is the given key region.
After executing this method, the keyIndex may have changed.
member.param: The index for the key to update.
The index for the time to update.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.CollectionTrace.CollectionTrace`1.ZeroState(System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Sets the state associated with the given key to zero.
After executing this method, the keyIndex may have changed.
member.param: The index for the key to update.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.CollectionTrace.CollectionTrace`1.IsZero(System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns true if the state associated with the given key is zero.
After executing this method, the keyIndex may have changed.
member.param: The index for the key to interrogate.
member.returns: True if the state associated with the given key is zero, otherwise false.

member.summary: Enumerates the entire collection for the given key at the given time, and stores it in the given list.
member.param: The key to enumerate.
The time at which to enumerate the collection.
The list that will be populated with records in the collection.

member.summary: Enumerates the difference for the given key at the given time, and stores it in the given list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.ExtensionMethods.AssumePartitionedBy``3(Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.Collection{``0,``1},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``2}})
member.summary: Instructs downstream operators to assume that the collection is partitioned according to the given key selector.
member.typeparam: The type of timestamp on each record.
The type of the input records.
member.param: The input collection.
Function that extracts a key from each record.
member.returns: The input collection.
member.remarks:
This operator supplies metadata for the given collection that allows downstream operators to optimize partitioning.
If the input collection is not partitioned according to the given key selector, the behavior of downstream operators is undefined.

The type of the input records.
member.param: The input collection.
member.returns: The input collection.
member.remarks:
This operator supplies metadata for the given collection that allows downstream operators to optimize the data representation.
If the input collection is not immutable, the behavior of downstream operators is undefined.

member.summary: EXPERIMENTAL: Adjusts the timestamp on each record, under the requirement that the timestamp may only advance.
member.typeparam: The type of timestamp on each record.
The type of the input records.
member.param: The input collection.
Function that maps a record and time to a new time for that record.
member.returns: See remarks.
member.remarks: This operator can be used in the inner loops of differential dataflow programs to "delay" the processing of individual records.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NaiadDataStreamProtocol`1
member.summary:
A set of callback methods that should be implemented to receive a stream that follows the Naiad remote data protocol.
The sequence of calls will be as follows:
((StartEpoch (Send*) EndEpoch)* Close)* (StartEpoch (Send*) EndEpoch)? Shutdown
member.typeparam: The type of records in this data stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NaiadDataStreamProtocol`1.StartEpoch
member.summary: Called before sending a batch of records in the same epoch.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NaiadDataStreamProtocol`1.Send(`0)
member.summary: Called for each record in an epoch.
member.param: The record being sent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NaiadDataStreamProtocol`1.EndEpoch
member.summary: Called after sending a batch of records in the same epoch.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NaiadDataStreamProtocol`1.Close
member.summary: Called at the end of a remote Naiad session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.NaiadDataStreamProtocol`1.Shutdown
member.summary: Called at the end of a remote Naiad session, and the final message sent to this object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.Naiad.Frameworks.DifferentialDataflow.BufferingDataStreamBroadcaster`1
member.summary: A data stream protocol handler that will broadcast data of a particular type to a group of zero or more Sockets or other protocol handlers, and aggregate the entire multiset of records seen so that they may be sent to new participants.
member.typeparam: The type of records in this data stream.
